description: godoc: added alt and title attributes to the "pop out" button

messages.text:
On Mon, Mar 12, 2012 at 9:57 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:

> Should it be an alt or title attribute?
>
> "View full screen" is sufficient, I think.
>


To show a tooltip with the text, it should be title; for accessibility
tools, it should be alt. May we use both?

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=cbd84deea923 ***

godoc: added alt and title attributes to the "pop out" button

R=adg
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5777071

Committer: Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org>

On 13 March 2012 12:10, Francisco Souza <franciscossouza@gmail.com> wrote:
> On Mon, Mar 12, 2012 at 9:57 PM, Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org> wrote:
>>
>> Should it be an alt or title attribute?
>>
>> "View full screen" is sufficient, I think.
>
>
>
> To show a tooltip with the text, it should be title; for accessibility
> tools, it should be alt. May we use both?

Sure.

Hello adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

Should it be an alt or title attribute?

"View full screen" is sufficient, I think.

Hello adg@golang.org (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

Please take another look.

subject: code review 5777071: godoc: added alt attribute to the "pop out" button
